VERMILLION
November 2, 1955
TO: Network Acceptance Subcommittee
J ohn HcTTq TTeTTO
Waldo Abbot, WUOM
John Regnell, WILL
Hugh Mix, WNAD
Subject: American Adventure, Hommage to Poets
Gentlemen:
Received
naeb headquarters
llUv 4 Iddo
A M
l
Listened with enjoyment to the Frost and Sandberg tapes.
Of the two, I.prefer Mr. Frost. Carl’s pious, soap-box
manner is a little hard to take. Despite the uneveness of
the two programs (fully explained by our Mir. Holt) I feel
that the idea is a good one. Previous presentations have
been excellent and I see no reason why the current series will
not be equally so. I vote yes.
Professor Pierce’s comments about Donne and Coleridge
are pithy and witty. The readings did not overwhelm me but
they were quite well done. I believe that “Hommage to Poets”
(don’t like this title very much) will be a fine addition to the
Network. Yes.
Trust that all benefited from the recent Convention. When
are we going to convene in a hotel that those of us operating
on skimpy budgets can afford to stay in for the entire convention.
finely
Jim Slack, Member
Network Acceptance
Subcommittee
J S/ms
